meanings.definition: The state or quality of being jumpy or nervous.
meanings.sent1: Her jumpinesses made her twitch whenever someone approached her unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: His jumpinesses were evident as he constantly looked over his shoulder in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The jumpinesses of the cat were comical as it pounced on a falling leaf.
meanings.sent4: The jumpinesses in the room were palpable, like electricity crackling in the air.
meanings.sent5: The jumpinesses of the rabbit were so extreme that even a gentle breeze made it startle.

meanings.definition: The tendency to startle easily or be on edge.
meanings.sent1: The sudden noise caused her jumpinesses to kick in, and she dropped her books.
meanings.sent2: His constant jumpinesses made it hard for him to relax in crowded places.
meanings.sent3: The jumpinesses of the squirrel were amusing as it leaped at the sight of a falling acorn.
meanings.sent4: The jumpinesses of the old house felt like it was haunted by restless spirits.
meanings.sent5: The jumpinesses of the child were so extreme that even a gentle tap on the shoulder made them jump.
